adrFormatAddress: 1515 Broadway, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: I love most of the shows aired on this channel, especially Everybody Loves Raymond and Roseanne. What I strongly dislike is watching a show, going to a commercial and finding a completely different program on. Someone is remiss in their job duties! Then I can't finish watching the episode that was already on. Get it together! I don't care for this bate and switch tactic at all.

text.text: I love most of the shows aired on this channel, especially Everybody Loves Raymond and Roseanne. What I strongly dislike is watching a show, going to a commercial and finding a completely different program on. Someone is remiss in their job duties! Then I can't finish watching the episode that was already on. Get it together! I don't care for this bate and switch tactic at all.

originalText.text:
More like one and a half stars. Started watching this network about twenty years ago when it actually played classic tv series. Fell in love with dozens of series like Get Smart, Gomer Pyle, Dick Van Dyke, MacGyver, Andy Griffith.

Unfortunately, over the course of the last decade, the network has drifted wildly off course. Currently, their classic tv programming is restricted from mid morning to mid afternoon and consists of only three series: Andy Griffith, Bonanza, and Gunsmoke. To make it worse, they ruin Andy Griffith, by either removing several minutes of the program for more @!#%%&@!!******@!&! commercials or they include the entire program unedited but add six @!##!@%&%^!! minutes of commercials.

Yet another reason why I don't really miss cable tv much anymore. Thank goodness I can get MeTV, Retro, and Antenna locally on the broadcast stations.
